entry.title: Windows High Contrast Mode, Forced Colors Mode And CSS Custom Properties

entry.title: Performance Signals For Customizing Website UX
entry.summary: Using signals to deliver less, or different, content is a form of progressive enhancement (or graceful degradation depending on how you look at it), whereby extraneous content is only loaded when necessary, but the core functionality of the website still works. In this article, we’ll look at some of the signals that can be used for this.

entry.title: How To Create An Information Architecture That Is Easy To Use
entry.summary: If users cannot find the answers to their questions or are not exposed to critical messaging, they will not act, and your website will fail. entry.title: A Recipe For A Good Design System
entry.summary: Maintaining a design system is a lot of work. In this article, Atila Fassina shares his lessons learned and how a platform such as Backlight can help put together a series of tools to speed up your architecture setup.
